definition: in quick succession, abounding, the location of something surrounded by other things
details:
adverb
- in quick succession
= example: in quick succession
= synonyms: thickly
- with a thick consistency
= example: with a thick consistency
= synonyms: thickly
adjective
- abounding
- describes someone that is stupid
= example: describes someone that is stupid
= synonyms: duncish, fatheaded, blockheaded, boneheaded, duncical, loggerheaded, thickheaded, thick-skulled, wooden-headed
- having component parts closely crowded together
- spoken as if with a thick tongue
= example: spoken as if with a thick tongue
= synonyms: slurred
- (of darkness) very intense
= example: (of darkness) very intense
= synonyms: deep
- hard to pass through because of dense growth
= synonyms: dense
- having a short and solid form or stature
= synonyms: compact, thickset, heavyset, stocky
- not thin
= example: not thin
- relatively dense in consistency
= example: relatively dense in consistency
- (used informally) associated on close terms
= synonyms: chummy
noun
- the location of something surrounded by other things
= synonyms: midst
